thread.title: Boy handcuffed at US border a ‘security threat’ - White House
thread.title_full: Boy handcuffed at US border a ‘security threat’ - White House

title: Boy handcuffed at US border a ‘security threat’ - White House
text:
Boy handcuffed at US border a ‘security threat’ - White House Last updated 14:36, February 2 2017 Other 
President Donald Trump's press secretary Sean Spicer said age does not determine whether someone poses a threat. 
A five-year-old boy who was handcuffed and detained for five hours at a US airport could have been a threat to America, the White House said. 
The child was detained at Washington DC's Dulles Airport after Donald Trump signed an order banning travel from seven majority Muslim countries. 
He was one of more than 100 people detained following President Donald Trump's Muslim ban. 
The boy is reunited with his mother. 
The schoolboy was allegedly handcuffed and separated from his mother after he was deemed as a possible threat. 
READ MORE: * Barack Obama breaks silence on Trump's Muslim ban 
He had reportedly flown into the airport with another family. 
Footage showed the boy's mother waiting anxiously before being reunited with her son and showering him with kisses. 
Speaking after the incident, Donald Trump's Press Secretary Sean Spicer said: 
"You can go through and nit-pick, but that's why we slow [the process] down a little. To make sure that if they are a 5-year-old, that maybe they're with their parents and they don't pose a threat. But to assume that just because of someone's age or gender or whatever that they don't pose a threat would be misguided and wrong." 
The boy, who was identified by Senator Chris Van Hollen as a US citizen who lives in Maryland. 
Van Hollen said it was "outrageous" the boy had been held for so long.
